item.title: 8 Best Puzzle Games Of The 2020s, Ranked (So Far)
item.description:
Puzzle games have always been a staple in the gaming world, dating back to point-and-click mystery games in the early days and evolving into expansive experiences that transcend the expectations of the sub-genre. As video games develop faster and faster, there have been plenty of innovations in the puzzle space with new technologies, ideas, and a wider range than ever of brain-melting stories to keep players scratching their heads for hours on end. With no boundaries set on the setting or theme of the game, developers have created countless worlds in every universe imaginable, from cartoon comedy to horror.

There's no shortage of thought-intensive media to explore and solve, and many games have innovated on some classic ideas from the past, adding endless replayability, VR support, and a boatload more features that keep the puzzles feeling modern and just as challenging as ever. Even gamers who might be more comfortable in fast-paced shooters or tactical RPGs can find joy in the world of puzzle games, with so much to figure out and very low barriers to entry that are only set by how creative and imaginative the players themselves can be.

8 A Little To The Left

Everything In Its Proper Place

Your comment has not been saved

A Little to the Left
Puzzle
Point-and-click
Systems
OpenCritic Reviews
Top Critic Avg: 77 /100 Critics Rec: 71%
Released
November 8, 2022

WHERE TO PLAY

DIGITAL
PHYSICAL

ESRB
e
OpenCritic Rating
Strong
Platform(s)
PC, Switch
Powered by

Sometimes, simplicity is king, stripping away the concept of complex game mechanics and hyper-realistic graphics in place of charming visuals and satisfying gameplay that still scratches that puzzle itch that so many players are looking for. A Little to the Left ticks those boxes perfectly, offering a relaxing organizational experience that still requires quite a bit of thought at times but isn't going to stretch the player to their absolute mental limit. A lot of the levels can be solved purely by moving items piece by piece, while others take a bit more thinking both in a logical sense and outside of the box.

With a few secrets and extras to find along the way, the game feels great in every single stage, offering satisfying sorting across a range of household items and objects and making the player want to do a bit of spring cleaning of their own. For players looking for complex and brain-tingling puzzles, the game does lack in that regard. But the overall relaxed experience of moving tools into different boxes, blowing out candles one by one, and sifting through piles of objects is still great and well worth playing for any fans of the puzzle genre or people looking for a calming and low-intensity game to play.

7 Little Nightmares 2

Cute Yet Horrifying

7 Images
7 Images

Your comment has not been saved

Little Nightmares 2
8 /10
4 /10
OpenCritic Reviews
Top Critic Avg: 82 /100 Critics Rec: 88%
Released
February 10, 2021

WHERE TO PLAY

DIGITAL
PHYSICAL

ESRB
T For Teen due to Blood, Violence
Developer(s)
Tarsier Studios, Supermassive Games
Platform(s)
Xbox Series X, Xbox Series S, Xbox One, PS4, PS5, PC
OpenCritic Rating
Strong
Powered by

It isn't easy to live up to the success of an initial title in a sequel, but Little Nightmares 2 certainly does and goes even beyond expectations of what a follow-up can and should be. The biggest draw for the game is the art style and dark, dingy setting that is entirely unique to the franchise and combines elements of horror with devilish puzzles to keep the player engaged and focused amidst the prying eyes of giants ready for a feast. Having an NPC companion to traverse the world with was a welcome change that builds upon plenty of the mechanics found in the original, whilst introducing some added depth with some new options and obstacles that need to be solved as a pair.

Puzzles have existed in horror games for many years now with varying levels of difficulty and challenge, but in Little Nightmares 2, the puzzles are fairly simple overall yet feel significantly more difficult, thanks to the stress and fear of being caught at any moment. By themselves, a player could clear any of them in a matter of moments, but being under constant pressure and time constraints makes each one feel like a momentous task once completed and constantly pushes the player's composure levels and tests their ability to perform under pressure. It would have been nice to see co-op as an option for the game, but with as was announced, players will have to wait to enter the gloomy world with a pal until the third installment that is coming very soon.

6 Blue Prince

Choose The Rooms Wisely

10 Images
10 Images

Your comment has not been saved

Blue Prince
10 /10
Released
April 10, 2025

WHERE TO PLAY

SUBSCRIPTION
DIGITAL

ESRB
E For Everyone // Alcohol Reference
Developer(s)
Dogubomb
Platform(s)
PlayStation 5, Xbox Series X, Xbox Series S, PC
Powered by

Bridging the gap between puzzles and roguelikes, Blue Prince is a fantastic game that has a very distinct feel that is hard to find elsewhere. Laid out like a dungeon-exploring board game, players are tasked with navigating an ever-expanding labyrinth of rooms inside a giant mansion, with the goal being to locate the hidden 46th room as requested by the protagonist's late grandfather. Blending hidden objects, escape rooms, and all the classic puzzle tropes players would expect, the game has a unique sense of replayability and a desire to keep going, as with each new day, the player has to start over, with a few upgrades to help the exploration next time.

It really does feel like a tabletop game, with the footstep governing how far the player can progress and limiting their ability to simply sprint around the place willy-nilly. The combination of strategy, thought, and constant engagement gives the game a new and exciting gameplay loop that stands out against other puzzle titles of a similar kind. It is a game that really rewards knowledge and understanding of the puzzles and the rooms themselves, and players can carefully select which room they want to place next, adding a level of choice and personality to the game and making each run have its own individual feel.

5 Escape Simulator

One Hint Is Never Enough

Your comment has not been saved

Escape Simulator
Puzzle
Adventure
Simulation
Indie Games
Systems
OpenCritic Reviews
Critics Rec: 100%
Released
October 19, 2021

WHERE TO PLAY

DIGITAL

ESRB
t
Platform(s)
Microsoft Windows, macOS
Powered by

The idea of working together to solve a set of puzzles and tasks sounds immensely fun and engaging, and for the trickier puzzles, two heads are better than one. With Escape Simualtor, players can hop into a level alone or with a partner and be tested at every single stage, with even a single room demanding so much of the players in such a small area. Each base level is full of hidden hints, mind-bending puzzles, and solutions to make both players go "aha" once solved, and the satisfaction that comes from clearing a tricky level together after spending quite a while stuck staring at the same set of symbols for 30 minutes is unmatched.

One of the best parts about the game is the integration with custom maps on the Steam workshop. It means that even after players have bested all the base levels and even the DLCs, there is a huge library of community maps that are equally, if not more, challenging than those in the original game, giving so much additional content and enough head-scratching to satiate anyone's hunger for puzzles. It is as close as it gets to a real escape room, and the variety of the problems and settings is immense, with no two stages being the same and all being the perfect way to test the player's mind and memory.

4 Viewfinder

A Whole New Perspective

Your comment has not been saved

Viewfinder
OpenCritic Reviews
Top Critic Avg: 83 /100 Critics Rec: 93%
Released
July 18, 2023

WHERE TO PLAY

DIGITAL

Platform(s)
PC, PlayStation 4, PlayStation 5
Powered by

Often times, puzzle games will take a concept and stretch it to its absolute limit, exploring different worlds and perspectives that are yet to be tapped into and creating unforgettable experiences that defy convention and normality. Viewfinder does exactly that, allowing the player to interact with the world in wild and amazing ways, like rotating entire structures to create new platforms or using photographs and screens as a means to traverse to the next area. Every single solution fills the player with pure joy, and every time a new mechanic or kind of perspective is introduced, it feels like an entirely new game dimension just entered the playing field.

There have been plenty of games that play with the concepts of altering perspectives in interesting ways, like Superliminal, for instance, but Viewfinder has its own individuality that keeps the puzzles interesting and engaging right until the very end. The whole world is expertly crafted with a narrative that can either be experienced passively or truly appreciated for the beautifully crafted moments that keep the player begging for more. It is a shame that the game is rather short compared to other titles that offer more gameplay, yet in just a short time, the game introduces a whole new world of puzzles that stand atop many others as some of the best out there.

3 Animal Well

As Stunning As It Is Puzzling

Your comment has not been saved

Animal Well
8.4 /10
OpenCritic Reviews
Top Critic Avg: 89 /100 Critics Rec: 98%
Released
May 9, 2024

WHERE TO PLAY

SUBSCRIPTION
DIGITAL

ESRB
E For Everyone Due To Mild Fantasy Violence
Developer(s)
Shared Memory
OpenCritic Rating
Mighty
Platform(s)
PS5, PC, Nintendo Switch, Xbox Series X, Xbox Series S
Powered by

Animal Well is a standout indie gem that thrusts players into a hauntingly beautiful pixel-art world where every screen brims with secrets waiting to be unraveled. As a lone blob navigating a labyrinthine underground, the game demands keen observation and creative problem-solving at every turn, with puzzles ranging from single-room conundrums to sprawling multi-area enigmas that test both logic and lateral thinking. The satisfaction of piecing together a solution, whether it’s using a yo-yo to flick a distant switch or blowing bubbles to ascend to new heights, delivers a rush of triumph that lingers long after the puzzle is cracked.

What elevates Animal Well beyond a typical puzzle platformer is its layered design and the sheer density of its mysteries. The game’s world is a treasure trove of hidden passages, cryptic symbols, and unconventional tools like Frisbees and Slinkies, each with multiple ingenious uses that unfold as players experiment and explore. Beyond the initial quest to gather four flames, a deeper post-game beckons, filled with secrets so intricate that they’ve sparked collaborative efforts among players worldwide. This ever-expanding well of discovery ensures that even after hours of play, the game retains its allure, challenging the sharpest minds to peel back its many layers. With its atmospheric tension and rewarding complexity, Animal Well stands as a testament to the power of puzzles to captivate and confound in equal measure.

2 The Talos Principle 2

Even More Mind-Bending Solutions

Your comment has not been saved

The Talos Principle II
8.5 /10
OpenCritic Reviews
Top Critic Avg: 89 /100 Critics Rec: 99%
Released
November 2, 2023

WHERE TO PLAY

DIGITAL

ESRB
t
Developer(s)
Croteam
Platform(s)
PlayStation 5, Xbox Series X and Series S, Microsoft Windows
OpenCritic Rating
Mighty
Powered by

Beautiful doesn't really do The Talos Principle 2 justice. A philosophical journey that explores many facets of the mind and the human condition, the game is more than just a simple set of puzzles in a sequence. It speaks to an inner craving for knowledge and understanding and delivers an experience that expands so much upon the original, both in stimulating the mind and provoking deep and interesting thought. The puzzles are solved through a variety of different tools and techniques, each giving the player even more options to create intricate solutions to the well-crafted puzzles that grace every second of the game.

And the environments are simply stunning. With so many different settings and worlds to explore and uncover, the game never feels empty or boring, as the background is constantly full of life and excitement that it is almost distracting and pulls the attention away from the puzzles in order to appreciate their glory. Now, with a third game in the series which is just as exceptional, this second entry is the perfect starting point for any fans of puzzle games looking for their next big hit, and the series as a whole is one of the best narratively and intellectually in all of the puzzle universe.

1 The Case of the Golden Idol

A Truly Interactive Whodunit Experience

Your comment has not been saved

The Case of the Golden Idol
9 /10
10 /10
OpenCritic Reviews
Top Critic Avg: 88 /100 Critics Rec: 97%
Released
October 13, 2022

WHERE TO PLAY

SUBSCRIPTION
DIGITAL

ESRB
T For Teen Due To Blood, Violence, Use of Alcohol, Sexual Themes, Partial Nudity
Developer(s)
Color Gray Games
Platform(s)
PC, Switch
OpenCritic Rating
Mighty
Powered by

There's nothing like a good mystery to get the cogs turning, and The Case of the Golden Idol is the pinnacle of the detective game, which not only brings a very quirky and individual art style but also provides a comedic yet intellectually stimulating experience that knows no contemporary. Solving each death requires careful attention to all the minute details and an eye for things that may be out of place, letting the player strap on their Sherlock Holmes cap and get down and dirty to reveal and uncover the mysteries of the crimes before them.

With several DLCs and a sequel that is equally good, the gameplay has such a distinctive feeling that it feels more like an actual mystery being solved by the player than a puzzling video game locked behind the screen. The whole game is a puzzle in essence, as with each clue uncovered and smaller detail realized, the player comes closer and closer to figuring out the culpret and there are plenty of twists and turns along the way to surprise and excite the player down the line, emulating a detective novel to perfection and redefining this sub-genre of gaming.

item.title: Baldur's Gate 3: How To Use Photo Mode In Patch 8
item.description:
Photo Mode, one of the most anticipated additions to Baldur’s Gate 3 since the game’s official launch, finally arrived with Patch 8, giving players far more freedom when taking screenshots. Now, thanks to this new tool, you can tilt and pan the camera while you explore the map and also enjoy full control over character placement and post‑processing.

With that freedom, players can craft fresh scenes that capture unique moments across the three acts that Baldur’s Gate 3 offers. The mode supports everything from lighthearted snapshots that embrace the Dungeons & Dragons silliness to intense, dramatic compositions, and its built‑in interface keeps the process smooth for newcomers and experts alike. So, for those looking to test their photography skills in Patch 8, here’s how to easily use the new Photo Mode in Baldur’s Gate 3 .

How To Use Photo Mode In Baldur’s Gate 3

Fortunately, accessing the photo mode in Baldur’s Gate 3 is not a complex task . At any moment during exploration or combat, PC players can simply press the F9 key or select the camera icon added below the mini-map to open the interface and explore all available customization options.

For those playing with a controller, the process is just as simple. Pressing both analog sticks simultaneously (R3+L3) will open Baldur’s Gate 3 ’s photo mode features. From there, players can freely adjust the camera position, apply visual filters, change the depth of field, and play with lighting to capture epic, emotional, or even comedic moments from their journey.

Controls For Photo Mode In Baldur’s Gate 3

The direct commands below let you frame shots without touching the side panels:

  • W A S D – Move the camera
  • Q E – Rotate the camera
  • Z X – Raise or lower the camera without tilting it
  • P – Show or hide the Photo Mode HUD
  • Space – Capture the image

For those playing with a controller, it's necessary to press Y/Triangle to control the camera. Then, simply press the same button again to access the HUD and manage the other customization options.

  • Left Stick – Move the camera
  • Right Stick – Rotate the camera
  • R1 L1 / RB LB – Tilt the camera
  • L2 / LT / R2 / RT (When controlling camera) – Raise or lower the camera without tilting it
  • L2 / LT – Show or hide the Photo Mode HUD
  • R2 / RT – Capture the image

However, the real freedom of Baldur’s Gate 3 ’s Photo Mode lies in the other options that the game provides, allowing players to go further in customization, not only making camera movements but also influencing the position or expression of the characters. For example, while the first two HUD menus enable the player to better configure where the camera will be or where it should focus, the other options go a bit further.

How To Customize Characters In Photo Mode For Baldur’s Gate 3

What makes Baldur’s Gate 3 ’s Photo Mode so impressive is the level of control players have when creating a shot. One of the key features is the ability to manipulate both the position and current actions of characters. To do this, players must access the third tab of the HUD, titled Character Settings, where they can make these adjustments freely.

Only one character can be edited at a time, and players can only customize party members, so, not enemies or NPCs. However, for those aiming for a cleaner shot, this tab also allows users to decide who appears in the screenshot. It’s possible to remove NPCs, enemies, or even allies from the composition.

  • Expression: This setting lets players change the facial expression of each character in the shot. There’s a wide selection of emotions available, and many of them include slight variations, offering plenty of variety for each photo.
  • Pose: Larian has created over 40 base poses for characters in Photo Mode, most of which include variations. This opens up even more creative possibilities for composing scenes, and players can get pretty creative when deciding where and how to position the characters, creating unique scenarios.

In addition to setting expressions and poses, players can fine-tune character placement by adjusting X, Y, Z coordinates and Rotation, placing each party member exactly where desired. Finally, the remaining options under Character Settings let players apply finishing touches, such as changing a character’s outfit to camp clothing or removing their helmet.

What Are The Post-Processing Effects In Baldur’s Gate 3?

Those looking to fine-tune their screenshots in Baldur’s Gate 3 can now rely on in-game tools rather than external software. With the release of Patch 8, the Photo Mode includes post-processing options like contrast, saturation, and other effects that enhance the final image directly within the game.

Setting

Description

Colour Grading

Alters the overall color tone using preset filters.

Contrast

Modifies the difference between light and dark areas.

Saturation

Controls how vivid the colors appear.

Highlights

Adjusts the brightness of the image’s lightest areas.

Brightness

Changes the overall light level of the image.

Vignette

Adds a light or dark fade around the edges of the frame.

Vignette Opacity

Adjusts the visibility of the vignette effect.

Vignette Thickness

Determines the width of the vignette’s fade area.

Unfortunately, Baldur's Gate 3 's Photo Mode isn't fully available during cutscenes or dialogues. It's a bit more limited, but players can still adjust stickers, frames, and post-processing effects. However, other options are not enabled during these moments.

How To Add Frames And Stickers In Baldur’s Gate 3

In Baldur’s Gate 3 ’s Photo Mode, players can take their creativity further using the Frames and Stickers options found in the fifth and sixth menus, respectively. The frame tab includes cinematic bars and artistic styles that help compose more polished visuals. Each frame's opacity and the size of the black bars can be adjusted to create a dramatic or minimalist look.

Stickers allow for up to 30 unique visual elements to be added to a single shot. Each one can be repositioned, resized, and individually adjusted for opacity. From humorous icons to dramatic effects, these tools add creative flexibility to highlight special moments. Whether crafting a meme or capturing a romantic scene, frames and stickers help make each screenshot more expressive and memorable.

Where Are Baldur’s Gate 3 Photos Saved?

For players using the Steam version, screenshots taken via Baldur’s Gate 3 ’s Photo Mode are saved in a dedicated folder created by Larian Studios. To access them, navigate to the following path:

C:(Username)\Documents\Larian Studios\Baldur’s Gate 3\Screenshots

However, if players use Steam’s native screenshot feature or another external capture tool, the images will be stored in that tool’s designated folder. Console users will also find their photos saved through system-specific apps. On PlayStation 5, the screenshots are stored in the Media Gallery, while Xbox Series X|S players can access their captures through the Capture & Share menu.

item.title: InZOI Player Recreates 90s TV Characters
item.description:
Summary

  • InZOI player recreated iconic 90s TV characters, impressing the community with realistic results.
  • Krafton's InZOI allows players to shape their world with realistic graphics and in-depth character creation.
  • Despite a drop in concurrent players, InZOI devs plan to support the game with hotfixes and new features like pets.

An inventive InZOI player has recreated the protagonists of The Fresh Prince of Bel-Air , Martin , and Family Matters TV shows. This is another recreation shared by the InZOI community, which has used the character creator's resources and obtained impressive results.

Known for the highly famous PUBG , Krafton released InZOI , a life simulator in which players take on the role of creators, shaping the world around them to live out unique stories. With highly realistic graphics developed in Unreal Engine 5, InZOI has cities inspired by real-world locations. Players can modify the weather, streets, and properties, opening up many gameplay possibilities. The game's release was highly positive despite some criticism, with players pointing to the in-depth character creator as one of the title's strongest aspects.

Redditor Brilliant-Bite-6591 showed off their recreation of the protagonists from The Fresh Prince of Bel-Air , Martin , and Family Matters . The impressive result shows the version of the character played by Will Smith with his signature mustache and earrings, green cap, and green and yellow shirt. Martin Payne, the protagonist of the series starring Martin Lawrence, is wearing a necklace and shirt similar to those of the character. The recreation also includes the haircut and traditional goatee sported by the comedian on the TV show. Finally, the OP shows their version of Steve Urkel with large glasses and a shirt similar in design to the character's.

InZOI Player Brings Nostalgia to the Game by Recreating Iconic 90s TV Characters

With six seasons, The Fresh Prince of Bel-Air was considered Will Smith's star vehicle on TV, helping to propel his career in film. Martin ran for five seasons and was one of Fox's highest-rated shows during its run. Family Matters ran for nine seasons and became a memorable part of 90s TV after the introduction of Urkel. Now the trio are part of Krafton's impressive list of simulator recreations, which include Nathan Drake from the Uncharted series and a jaw-dropping recreation of actress Cynthia Erivo in InZOI , along with her character from Wicked , Elphaba.

InZOI reached a big milestone relatively soon after launch but saw a massive drop in concurrent players not long after. Despite this, the devs have revealed their plans for supporting the game, including hotfixes to be released throughout April to fix issues and address community feedback. One of these requests was addressed a few weeks ago, with InZOI reducing the aging speed of the Zois in one of its updates. In a future patch, the game promises to bring another highly requested feature by adding pets.

7 Images
7 Images

item.title: AI Limit: How to Get More Life Dews (Healing Charges)
item.description:
Life Dews are the player's main sources of healing in AI Limit. They restore a nice chunk of health when consumed, and they recharge when you interact with a Branch too, making them Arissa's best friend throughout her journey across Havenswell.

With how lethal everything is in this game, players will want to get as many Life Dews in their pockets as possible. This isn't any different from the usual song-and-dance found in other Soulslike games, and like in many of AI Limit's predecessors, upgrading Life Dews is a simple-yet-time-consuming process.

How to Get More Life Dews in AI Limit

All players start with three Life Dews, but once they fight their way out of the sewers in the very early part of the game, they'll be able to get more by finding Soil . After reaching the Outer Wall area, you'll eventually reach a survivor camp where an NPC named Delpha, a self-proclaimed botanist who is trying to revive plants. He is standing under a tent near the entrance of the camp.

If you speak with Delpha, he'll give you your first Fine Soil sample. Once you have it, go to the nearby Branch and select the Cultivate option . By doing this, Arissa will drop the soil onto the Branch, increasing the number of Life Dews you can carry in the process.

Delpha will then ask you to bring him any Soil samples you find in the city. Bring those to him, and he'll give you more Fine Soil for the branch. There are seven Soil samples in the city, and you'll find them in the following areas:

  • Sunken City Overground - Flooded Street (Survivors' Stronghold)
  • Sunken City Underground - Underground Parish (Mansion Ground Floor)
  • Twilight Hill - Withered Forest (Deadwoods)
  • Twilight Hill - Spirit Depths (Watch Tower)
  • Twilight Hill - Withered Forest (Arboretum)
  • Sewer Town - Center (Subway Station)
  • Sewer Town - North (Sedimentation Tank)

How to Upgrade Life Dew Healing Effectiveness

Apart from getting more Life Dew charges, players can also increase the healing they get from each charge by getting Dew Essence. Unlike Fine Soil, Dew Essence does not need to be used, consumed, or offered to Branches. Instead, you only need to keep them in your inventory to enjoy their effect.

You can get Dew Essences by finding and killing giant snails and butterflies . Almost every level has one, and there are 10 Dew Essences in total. These giant insects are often in hidden areas in each level — the paths to some are hidden in plain sight, while others are locked behind doors that require specific keys. Exploring maps is something that all AI Limit players should be doing, so make sure to search every nook and cranny for secrets.

In some cases, Dew Essences are held by powerful foes.

item.title: A Red Dead Redemption Spin-Off in the Style of South of Midnight Wouldn't Feel Out of Place
item.description:
Although Rockstar Games has always grounded Red Dead Redemption in realism, Lemoyne, the game's southeastern region, quietly introduced a canvas that could support something more surreal. The ghostly fog of Bayou Nwa and the decaying remnants of old Southern estates could be more than just a setting. If Rockstar was to ever return to the action-adventure open-world game, a spin-off taking inspiration from South of Midnight could be the way forward.

Indeed, RDR adopting influences from South of Midnight wouldn’t demand reinventing the wheel—it would simply mean leaning into what’s already present, especially considering everything the state of Lemoyne already offers. Plus, Red Dead Redemption already had themes like crime, voodoo, and superstition in places like Lagras and Saint Denis.

Lemoyne is Already Halfway to a South of Midnight-Style Red Dead Redemption Romp

Lemoyne is divided into two primary regions: Bayou Nwa and Scarlett Meadows. Bayou Nwa is the most visually aligned with South of Midnight ’s brand as it exudes a Southern Gothic tone. It’s filled with thick mist, dilapidated fishing shacks, rotting wooden docks, and hostile alligator populations. The town of Lagras from RDR2 , in particular, feels disconnected from time as its residents speak in dialects unique even within the Red Dead world, and its isolation makes it feel like a pocket dimension within the map.

On the other hand, Scarlett Meadows has that faded grandeur of old plantations and Confederate echoes that could thematically anchor a story about cultural decay, buried secrets, or mystical hauntings. The region’s ruined mansions, crumbling family legacies, and proximity to Saint Denis, inspired by New Orleans, create a believable backdrop for a more mythic, character-driven story, too.

Fans Would Appreciate a Spin-off That Doesn’t Break Red Dead’s Rules But Also Has Entirely New Dynamics

If a Red Dead spin-off was to channel magical undertones, it wouldn’t require fireballs or floating enemies. Cursed artifacts, whispered legends, or a protagonist with spiritual visions paint a picture here, and these elements wouldn’t contradict the Red Dead universe either if presented as ambiguous or myth-driven instead of supernatural facts. Rockstar already toys with this through NPC rumors, ghost encounters, and eerie side quests. A spin-off could turn that ambient weirdness into its main focus, and it may even diversify the lore instead of breaking it.

A Stylized Red Dead Could Expand the Brand Without Diluting It

One of Rockstar’s biggest strengths is its flexibility in tone, and a Red Dead spin-off could prove that the franchise can stretch without snapping. Just as Grand Theft Auto has evolved in both satire and storytelling formats, Red Dead could branch out into something artistically daring without losing its soul. The key lies in not remaking South of Midnight but in absorbing RDR ’s DNA, rhythm, and myth-making and applying them to a familiar but underutilized setting.

A stylized, folklore-inspired Red Dead game around Lemoyne could explore forgotten rituals, generational trauma, and legends passed down in whispers. It wouldn’t compete with Red Dead ’s mainline games, either, and instead it could complement them by making use of map regions that serve more as atmospheric filler in RDR2 . In doing so, Rockstar could open a door to new audiences.
